content:
eBay's advanced search features are a powerful tool to find completed listings for similar items. I'd be happy to guide you through the process.

**eBay Advanced Search:**

1. **Access Advanced Search:** From the eBay homepage, click on the "Advanced" link next to the search bar.
2. **Enter keywords:** In the "Keywords" field, enter specific keywords related to your items. For example:
	* For the Tag Heuer Carrera watch: "Tag Heuer Carrera limited edition", "Tag Heuer Carrera vintage", or "Tag Heuer Carrera [specific model number]"
	* For the Sony Walkman Professional: "Sony Walkman Professional 1980s", "Sony Walkman Professional vintage", or "Sony Walkman Professional [specific model number]"
3. **Select "Completed listings"**: In the "Search including" section, select "Completed listings" to only show listings that have ended.
4. **Set a time filter:** In the "Completed listings" section, choose a time filter, such as "Last 30 days" or "Last 3 months", to get a sense of recent sales data.
5. **Add additional filters:** You can refine your search by adding more filters, such as:
	* "Price: Lowest first" or "Price: Highest first" to see the price range of completed listings.
	* "Condition: Used" or "Condition: New" to filter by the condition of the item.
	* "Location: [Your country/region]" to see listings from a specific location.
6. **Click "Search"**: Once you've set your filters, click the "Search" button to see the results.

**Tips and Keywords:**

* Use specific keywords related to your item, including the brand, model, year, and any distinctive features (e.g., "Tag Heuer Carrera Calibre 5" or "Sony Walkman Professional WM-D6C").
* Include keywords like "vintage", "rare", "collectible", or "limited edition" to target relevant listings.
* Use eBay's "Category" filter to narrow down the results to specific categories, such as "Jewelry & Watches" or "Electronics > Portable Audio > Walkmans".
* Pay attention to the "Sold" and "Ended" listings, as they will give you an idea of the prices that buyers are willing to pay.
* Take note of the seller's feedback, ratings, and the number of bids or watchers to gauge the demand and reputation of the seller.

**Additional Tips:**

* Use eBay's "Price Research" tool, which can be found on the right-hand side of the search results page. This tool provides a price range for completed listings based on the keywords you've entered.
* Keep an eye on the " watchers" count, as it can indicate the level of interest in the item.
* Analyze the listing titles, descriptions, and photos to understand what makes a listing successful and how you can improve your own listing.

By following these steps and using the right keywords, you'll be able to find relevant completed listings for your items and get a better understanding of their market value.
